description: A quarter of police officers in Shanghai carried guns during routine patrols for the first time this week as part of an effort to increase police firepower after a deadly mass knifing in the city of Kunming last month.
title: China: Some Police Officers Begin to Carry Guns in Several Cities
title_page: China: Some Police Officers Begin to Carry Guns in Several Cities - The New York Times
maintext: A quarter of the police officers in Shanghai began carrying guns during routine patrols for the first time this week as part of a China-wide effort to increase police firepower after a deadly mass knifing in the southwestern city of Kunming last month. Police officers in China generally do not carry firearms. China plans to introduce the armed police patrols in several major cities and started last Thursday in Xiâ€™an and over the weekend in Shanghai and Qingdao. The state Public Security Ministry said the campaign for armed police patrols also would extend to the southern cities of Changsha and Kunming, as well the main cities in the restive ethnic regions of Xinjiang and Tibet, although those areas already have experienced tight security crackdowns that include armed paramilitary police.
